questions.text: Language:  The third letter of the Hebrew alphabet is also the name for a certain animal that might be familiar to the region.  Name either the letter or the animal.
questions.explanation:
camel & gimel & g.

	The third letter of the Hebrew alphabet is 'gimel' which means 'camel' and would be translated as 'g'.  I can't represent the actual Hebrew letter here, unfortunately...

questions.text: Geography:  Which area of Hong Kong has a name which means '9 dragons' in Cantonese?
questions.explanation:
Kowloon.

	Kowloon (or Jiulong in Mandarin) refers to 9 dragons, a reference to Chinese myth.  It can be found on the southern tip of mainland Hong Kong, just across the bay from Hong Kong Island.  By the way, did you know that the name 'Mekong' from the Mekong River also means '9 dragons'?

questions.text: Space:  What was significant about the Soviet Luna II mission?
questions.explanation:
First lunar impact.

	The Soviet Luna II mission of September 1959 ended in lunar impact, that is...it crashed on the moon!  It was deemed a success nonetheless.  The Soviet Luna I mission of the previous January was the first manmade satellite to escape Earth's gravity, and it also led to the discovery of solar winds.

questions.text: Animal Kingdom:  To which order of mammals do hedgehogs, shrews and moles belong?
questions.explanation:
Insectivora.

	It may come as a surprise that these creatures are not classified as rodents.  Insectivores are small, nocturnal creatures that dine exclusively on...bugs.

questions.text: Art History:  What is the name of the Indian painting treatise, which greatly emphasizes  the research of anatomical movements of its figures?
History: Who was the mighty figure that conquered most of India in 260 B.C. and established Buddhism as the state religion?
questions.explanation:
Asoka.

	Unfortunately, his faith did not last and Buddhism eventually faded from prominence in India, but it did gain a foothold in the surrounding regions.

questions.text: Saints:  What monk from the Spaso-Andronilov monastery was said to be able to work miracles from his iconic paintings?
questions.explanation:
Andrew Rublev.

	Rublev was made a saint and his feast day is on July 4th, an easy day to remember.  He was the greatest of Russian iconographers, making his paintings speak the gospel for him.

questions.text: Ancient Art:  Which Greek painter was called "The Father of Painting"?
questions.explanation:
Apelles.

	Apelles applied a varnish to harmonize the color and backgrounds, giving the figures a three-dimensional quality, and thereby destroying the 2-dimensional space.

questions.text: Religion:  What is the name of the Goddess worshipped in Dakshineswar, India?
questions.explanation:
Kali.

	Kali is a fearsome figure that sprang forth from the forehead of the Hindu goddess Durga.  She wears a garland of skulls, a symbol of reincarnation, about her neck.

questions.text: Myth: What person of Sumerian myth was 2/3 god and 1/3 human?
questions.explanation:
Gilgamesh.

	Gilgamesh is the hero of the great Sumerian epic of the same name.  It is said that Gilgamesh was an actual king of the earliest Sumerian dynasty in Uruk, the first capital.  With his best friend Enkidu he had many exciting adventures.
